name: Magnetic Flesh: Lost Heart
description:
Eli Joteva, 2021
JPG, 2000x2000 px

Heart still derived from MRI DTI data of the artist's body. Full project at intrabeing.joteva.com by @joteva

IntraBeing envisions enigmatic spaces beyond the capacities of medical imaging tools. The project employs MRI-acquired data to reveal alternative time scales inside the human body. During the STEAM III Imaging residency, Joteva worked with scientists at Fraunhofer MEVIS to investigate the capacities of medical imaging and simulation procedures in order to locate enigmatic spaces that emerge at the limits of their resolution and computation. She conducted a series of full body MRI scans and Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) scans, commonly used only to show connectivity in the brain, to instead uncover nerve fibers in her chest, pelvic and feet regions. The project premiered at Ars Electronica, 2021 and excerpts of it are presented in the first AlterHEN exhibition (alterhen.art).
